programme.title: The FIFA World Cup 2026 - Final Draw
programme.desc: The final draw for the FIFA World Cup 26 will take place on Friday, 5 December 2025 and will be hosted from the Kennedy Center in Washington DC. 42 of the 48 nations participating in next summer’s FIFA World Cup will be represented in the final draw. Six of the 48 teams at FIFA World Cup 26 have yet to be determined and will only be known in March 2026. The FIFA World Cup 26 is live and exclusive only on beIN.

programme.title: UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 Review

programme.title: ONE Fight Night 38 - 2025
programme.desc: ONE Fight Night 38 brings a stacked card to Bangkok for the final U.S. primetime show of the year. Bantamweight king Fabricio Andrade defends his crown against rising contender Enkh-Orgil Baatarkhuu, while Diogo Reis meets Daiki Yonekura for the Flyweight Submission Grappling World Title. The lineup also features Liam Harrison, Marcelo Garcia, Isi Fitikefu, and Dzhabir Dzhabrailov.

programme.title: Moto GP 2025 Highlights - Valencia
Moto GP 2025 Highlights - Valencia
Marc Márquez: More than a Comeback
programme.desc: After 2,184 days, 108 crashes, six surgeries and 30 missed Grands Prix, Marc Marquez has once again claimed the MotoGP World Championship title, doing so for an astonishing seventh time. But it’s been more than a comeback for the Spanish rider, who has endured his own personal calvary over the past six years. Through exclusive interviews with Marc, his friends and family, and never-before-seen footage, this 30-minute documentary provides previously unheard perspectives on the highs and lows of the Spaniard’s arduous journey back to the top of Grand Prix motorcycle racing

programme.title: The Highest Low
programme.desc: The World Cup is the highlight of any footballers career. But it can also bring about some of the lowest feelings - the pain of defeat, the agony of going so close but missing out on the biggest prize of all. This documentary speaks to some of those that have experienced the range of emotions that playing in a World Cup can deliver.

programme.title: Story of FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022
programme.desc: World Cup Qatar 2022 on the field was stellar. From the surprises, shocks and upsets in the group stages to the excitement of the knockout rounds - and arguably the best final ever - this World Cup has excelled.

programme.title: Qatar 2022 Arabic: A Lasting Legacy
programme.desc: Re-live an unforgettable month in Qatar as the World Cup came to the Middle East for the first time, culminating in the most outstanding World Cup final ever. Over four episodes, the series will look into the pride of the Arabic nations and their performances, the games and moments that stood out throughout the tournament, the journey of Argentina from opening defeat to lifting the trophy and the questions answered by Qatar as hosts.

programme.title: The FIFA World Cup 2026 - Final Draw
programme.desc: The final draw for the FIFA World Cup 26 will take place on Friday, 5 December 2025 and will be hosted from the Kennedy Center in Washington DC. 42 of the 48 nations participating in next summer’s FIFA World Cup will be represented in the final draw. Six of the 48 teams at FIFA World Cup 26 have yet to be determined and will only be known in March 2026. The FIFA World Cup 26 is live and exclusive only on beIN.

programme.title: Sharjah FC (UAE) vs Al Gharafa SC (QAT) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: This will be the first ever AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Sharjah and Al Gharafa; Qatari teams are unbeaten in their last five matches against UAE sides in the competition, with the last defeat being Al Gharafa’s 1-2 loss to Al Wasl last season. Sharjah have won only once in six matches against Qatari teams in the AFC Champions League Elite and have failed to score in their last two such games despite 19 shots, with an expected goals tally of just 1.0.

programme.title: Sharjah FC (UAE) vs Al Gharafa SC (QAT) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: This will be the first ever AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Sharjah and Al Gharafa; Qatari teams are unbeaten in their last five matches against UAE sides in the competition, with the last defeat being Al Gharafa’s 1-2 loss to Al Wasl last season. Sharjah have won only once in six matches against Qatari teams in the AFC Champions League Elite and have failed to score in their last two such games despite 19 shots, with an expected goals tally of just 1.0.

programme.title: Al Wahda FC (UAE) vs Al Ittihad Club (KSA) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: Al Wahda are unbeaten in each of their last three AFC Champions League Elite matches against Al-Ittihad, having lost each of their three meetings in the competition prior to then; in fact, Al Wahda have scored five times in their last two games against Al-Ittihad in the competition, after failing to score even one goal in the first four such meetings between the two sides. Al Wahda have failed to win any of their last seven opening games in the AFC Champions League Elite, last doing so in 2007 ; in fact, they have failed to score in each of their last three such matches in the competition.

programme.title: Al Wahda FC (UAE) vs Al Ittihad Club (KSA) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: Al Wahda are unbeaten in each of their last three AFC Champions League Elite matches against Al-Ittihad, having lost each of their three meetings in the competition prior to then; in fact, Al Wahda have scored five times in their last two games against Al-Ittihad in the competition, after failing to score even one goal in the first four such meetings between the two sides. Al Wahda have failed to win any of their last seven opening games in the AFC Champions League Elite, last doing so in 2007 ; in fact, they have failed to score in each of their last three such matches in the competition.

programme.title: Melbourne City FC (AUS) vs Sanfrecce Hiroshima (JPN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East M
programme.desc: This will be the first-ever AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Melbourne City and Sanfrecce Hiroshima; City are winless in each of their two games against Japanese opposition in the competition, while a win for Sanfrecce would see them beat Australian opponents in three consecutive games for the first time in competition history. Melbourne City are winless in each of their last three matches in the AFC Champions League Elite, their longest such run in the competition; in fact, they have begun each of their previous two campaigns in the competition with draws.

programme.title: Melbourne City FC (AUS) vs Sanfrecce Hiroshima (JPN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East M
programme.desc: This will be the first-ever AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Melbourne City and Sanfrecce Hiroshima; City are winless in each of their two games against Japanese opposition in the competition, while a win for Sanfrecce would see them beat Australian opponents in three consecutive games for the first time in competition history. Melbourne City are winless in each of their last three matches in the AFC Champions League Elite, their longest such run in the competition; in fact, they have begun each of their previous two campaigns in the competition with draws.

programme.title: Gangwon FC (KOR) vs Shanghai Shenhua FC (CHN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD1
programme.desc: This will be the first AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Gangwon and Shanghai Shenhua, with the former set to play their first-ever game in the competition; Shenhua have lost each of their last two matches against South Korean opposition in the Champions League Elite, another defeat here will see them equal their longest such run in competition history. Shanghai Shenhua lost their most recent AFC Champions League Elite match 0-4 to Kawasaki Frontale on 12 March 2025; failure to score against Gangwon will see them go scoreless in consecutive games for the first time in the competition since May 2011.

programme.title: Gangwon FC (KOR) vs Shanghai Shenhua FC (CHN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD1
programme.desc: This will be the first AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Gangwon and Shanghai Shenhua, with the former set to play their first-ever game in the competition; Shenhua have lost each of their last two matches against South Korean opposition in the Champions League Elite, another defeat here will see them equal their longest such run in competition history. Shanghai Shenhua lost their most recent AFC Champions League Elite match 0-4 to Kawasaki Frontale on 12 March 2025; failure to score against Gangwon will see them go scoreless in consecutive games for the first time in the competition since May 2011.

programme.title: Al Ahli Saudi FC (KSA) vs PFC Nasaf (UZB) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: This will be the fifth AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Al-Ahli and Nasaf, with Nasaf’s only win coming in their most recent such game on 2 March 2016 ; Al-Ahli’s most recent game in the competition against Uzbek opposition was a 2-1 win over Pakhtakor Tashkent on 20 May 2019, a win here will see them win two consecutive such games for the first time in competition history. Al-Ahli are unbeaten in each of their last 18 AFC Champions League Elite games, including the final of the 2024-25 edition ; avoiding defeat here will see them equal Gamba Osaka for the joint third-longest such run in the competition.

programme.title: Al Ahli Saudi FC (KSA) vs PFC Nasaf (UZB) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: This will be the fifth AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Al-Ahli and Nasaf, with Nasaf’s only win coming in their most recent such game on 2 March 2016 ; Al-Ahli’s most recent game in the competition against Uzbek opposition was a 2-1 win over Pakhtakor Tashkent on 20 May 2019, a win here will see them win two consecutive such games for the first time in competition history. Al-Ahli are unbeaten in each of their last 18 AFC Champions League Elite games, including the final of the 2024-25 edition ; avoiding defeat here will see them equal Gamba Osaka for the joint third-longest such run in the competition.

programme.title: AIX vs Nimes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.desc: The 2025–26 UEFA Europa League is the secondary club football tournament organised by UEFA. programme.title: ONE Fight Night 38 - 2025
programme.desc: ONE Fight Night 38 brings a stacked card to Bangkok for the final U.S. primetime show of the year. Bantamweight king Fabricio Andrade defends his crown against rising contender Enkh-Orgil Baatarkhuu, while Diogo Reis meets Daiki Yonekura for the Flyweight Submission Grappling World Title. The lineup also features Liam Harrison, Marcelo Garcia, Isi Fitikefu, and Dzhabir Dzhabrailov.

programme.desc: ONE Fight Night 38 brings a stacked card to Bangkok for the final U.S. primetime show of the year. Bantamweight king Fabricio Andrade defends his crown against rising contender Enkh-Orgil Baatarkhuu, while Diogo Reis meets Daiki Yonekura for the Flyweight Submission Grappling World Title. The lineup also features Liam Harrison, Marcelo Garcia, Isi Fitikefu, and Dzhabir Dzhabrailov.

programme.title: Qualifying - FIA Formula 2 Championship - Yas Island Round
programme.desc: The FIA Formula 2 Championship concludes at Yas Marina, a demanding circuit with long straights and tight technical sections that reward precision and tyre management. Featuring a sprint and a feature race, the season’s final round often decides the title, showcasing future Formula 1 talent in a high-pressure championship showdown.

programme.title: GP Confidential 2025 Magazine
programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Across 25 episodes and in crisp 3D animations, we analyses the technical details, which decide which teams make the most of the rules - and which need to go back to the drawing board. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: PALESTINE, ONE JERSEY, MANY ROOTS
programme.desc: Story of the Palestinian national football team, a team that is far more than the sum of its players. Separated by borders, by checkpoints, and exile, the tells is inspiring “One Jersey…Many Roots” them is a single jersey, a shared dream, and a deep sense of responsibility to players come from every corner of Palestine and from communities scattered across the globe. What unites represent their people on and off the pitch that Palestine endures. This is not just in every match, they carry not just a ball but the weight of history, identity and hope. Fot their supporters, each goal is a voice, each victory a declaration. Football it s a living emblem of unity, resilience and the unbreakable b

programme.title: Special Coverage Arab Cup FIFA Qatar 2025
programme.desc: The second edition of the FIFA Arab Cup is scheduled to be held in Qatar from December 1 to 18, 2025. The tournament will be hosted across six venues, all of which were utilized during the FIFA World Cup™ three years prior. As with Qatar 2022, Al Bayt Stadium will host the tournament's opening match, while the prestigious Lusail Stadium will serve as the venue for the final. Stay updated with comprehensive coverage of the Arab Cup Qatar 2025 on BeIN Sports News.

programme.title: Special Coverage FIFA World Cup 2026 Final Draw
programme.desc: On Friday, 5 December, participating teams will find out which pathway they must follow in their quest to lift the trophy in New York New Jersey on Sunday, 19 July 2026. Follow the 2026 World Cup draw ceremony in special coverage on BeIN Sports.

programme.title: The FIFA World Cup 2026 - Final Draw
programme.desc: The final draw for the FIFA World Cup 26 will take place on Friday, 5 December 2025 and will be hosted from the Kennedy Center in Washington DC. 42 of the 48 nations participating in next summer’s FIFA World Cup will be represented in the final draw. Six of the 48 teams at FIFA World Cup 26 have yet to be determined and will only be known in March 2026. The FIFA World Cup 26 is live and exclusive only on beIN.

programme.title: The FIFA World Cup 2026 - Final Draw
programme.desc: The final draw for the FIFA World Cup 26 will take place on Friday, 5 December 2025 and will be hosted from the Kennedy Center in Washington DC. 42 of the 48 nations participating in next summer’s FIFA World Cup will be represented in the final draw. Six of the 48 teams at FIFA World Cup 26 have yet to be determined and will only be known in March 2026. The FIFA World Cup 26 is live and exclusive only on beIN.

As with Qatar 2022, Al Bayt Stadium will host the tournament's opening match, while the prestigious Lusail Stadium will serve as the venue for the final. Stay updated with comprehensive coverage of the Arab Cup Qatar 2025 on BeIN Sports News.

programme.title: The FIFA World Cup 2026 - Final Draw
programme.desc: The final draw for the FIFA World Cup 26 will take place on Friday, 5 December 2025 and will be hosted from the Kennedy Center in Washington DC. 42 of the 48 nations participating in next summer’s FIFA World Cup will be represented in the final draw. Six of the 48 teams at FIFA World Cup 26 have yet to be determined and will only be known in March 2026. The FIFA World Cup 26 is live and exclusive only on beIN.
